column5: Have any of you ever stayed at one of the outpost camps at Halley's out of Minaki. Their website is "The outpost company". I am looking for a comfortable fly in for walleyes and pike.Thanks for your info.
Geez Roadhunter,it seems no one here wants to offer any advice on Halleys. Maybe that should tell you something!!!
Roadhunter, Take a look at the following post on this same page. I think it covers what you're looking for."MAYNARD LAKE, BIG NORTH OUTPOST, HELP"

We have stayed at the Caribou Falls camp (drive in) two years and find it a real nice operation. Would recommend it to anyone. They are a reputable outfit so would imagine the fly in operation is well done.Paul

>We have stayed at the Caribou Falls camp (drive in) two >years and find it a real nice operation. Would recommend it >to anyone. They are a reputable outfit so would imagine the >fly in operation is well done. >Paul DOn't be telling them about OUR fishing spot!
I stayed at their drive in camp-they could have cared less if I lived or died-I have fished many different places-this is only place I would never go back to due to indifferent service

I have been to Rex lake outpost Roger lake and one man lake. One man lake is an american plan very well run good food great walleye fishing full service. Rex was an outstanding smallie experience with a very difficult portage to little rex for walleyes. roger was a great walley lake with some pretty good sammllmouth. I have had great times at halleys.
